1409929212333543429.text: This is a ‘win-win-win’: new, novel drugs to treat infections, enhanced stewardship by preventing unnecessary use of the drugs, and protected access by keeping the drugs at no cost to patients. Development, stewardship, and access – the three prongs of an effective #AMR strategy.

1409929211381530627.text: By ‘de-linking’ revenue from sales, small pharmaceutical companies can recoup the costs of development over time, without having to sell large amounts of the drug to stay in business (that's important because overuse of these drugs promotes resistance).

1409929209989025800.text: The #PASTEURAct would change the way that the government pays for #antibiotics and #antivirals. Instead of paying by volume, the government would enter into a contract based on the value of the drug.

1409929209162735620.text: #AMRchat Q7: What is the #PASTEURAct  and how would it address #AntibioticResistance ?

1409925881032814592.text: That’s why we need to find creative ways to pull researchers back into the space, like I’m trying to do with the PASTEUR Act!

1409925880185511942.text: Unlike insulin patients take every day - or chemotherapy which is extremely expensive - antibiotics are meant to be used sparingly, and we want them to remain affordable for patients. So, most of the major pharmaceutical companies have left R&D space for more attractive options.

1409925879497691137.text: #AMRchat Q3: Why aren’t there new antibiotics being developed?
